New Records: Josh Hart became the first Knicks player since Michael Ray Richardson in 1981 with consecutive triple-doubles.
Josh Hart has four triple-doubles this season and became the fourth player to have 10 triple-doubles with the Knicks.
Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns had 31 points and 21 rebounds.
Josh Hart notched his second straight triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Mikal Bridges scored 27 points and OG Anunoby had 22 for the Knicks.
Jordan Clarkson and Collin Sexton each scored 25 points for the Jazz.
New York had to change plans after Deuce McBride developed left hamstring tightness during warmups.
Cam Payne replaced Jalen Brunson and finished with eight points and nine assists.

Rookie Tyler Kolek played 12 minutes off the bench after logging 40 minutes earlier in the day in a G League game, finishing with 36 points and 11 assists in the Westchester Knicks’ overtime victory over Indiana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks have won 14 of their last 16 games.
